If two conditions for the determination of the pointhare lacking, the locus of the point is a surface, which may be plane. spherical, or more complex. The ancients attempted nothing beyond the composition of solid loci, and it would appear that the sole aim of Apollonius in his treatise on the conic sections was the solution of problems of solid loci.
